body: What would/should be the difference to invoking `HonoClient.shutdown()`?

A `HonoClient.shutdown()` invocation causes all subsequent `HonoClient.connect` invocations to fail. I.e. the HonoClient can't be used anymore after that.

A `disconnect` should allow further `connect` invocations.

issue.title: Possible NP dereference of vertx in HonoClientImpl
issue.body:
While looking into issue #500, I came across a potential NPE in the HonoClientImpl code. During instantiation, when the supplied `vertx` instance happens to be `null`, then `vertx.getOrCreateContext()` will thrown a NPE. This PR fixes that + apply constructor chaining (since both constructors looks pretty similar)

@calohmn can you verify and then close this issue, if it works for you?

Re-test successful.

What is perhaps somewhat unexpected, is that the `disconnect completionHandler` is called directly after having sent the "close" frame, without waiting for a "close" frame response or for the underlying transport connection to be disconnected.

Log output where the `disconnect completionHandler` is doing a new `connect` - see the late `closed connection to server` log line:
````

  16:08:25.576 INFO  o.e.hono.example.ExampleReceiver - ##### disconnect completionHandler succeeded; now reconnect...

16:08:25.582 DEBUG o.e.hono.client.impl.HonoClientImpl - starting attempt [#1] to connect to server [192.168.99.100:30071]
````

But IMHO that shouldn't be a problem and will speed up reconnect operations a bit.

> What is perhaps somewhat unexpected, is that the disconnect completionHandler is called directly after having sent the "close" frame, without waiting for a "close" frame response or for the underlying transport connection to be disconnected.

this is because we cannot be sure that the peer will actually send one and we actually do not care as well because from our point of view, the connection is closed anyway ...
